intro: Torilis elongata, commonly known as the slender milkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features slender, branching stems and small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a rough texture. Torilis elongata is known for its milky sap, which can cause skin irritation upon contact.
